chapter.title: Genral Elements and Other Elements not Discussed Elsewhere

section.title: Overview
section.para: Since Docbook was defined to describe a wide range of publishable content, it includes a number of elements that are used to perform common tasks. These elements include ones that specify superscripts and emphasis.

It also includes a number of elements that you are unlikely to need when documenting CeltiXfire. Among these elements are a large set used to define GUI elements. These elements are legal in the CeltiXfire documentation. However, they are not used enough to mertit a full discussion.

section.title: Formating Elements
section.para: The following are common formating elements used in Docbook:

seglistitem.seg: Specifies that the content of the element is to be empasized by either itallics or boldface. The default is to use itallics. You specify boldface by setting the role attribute to strong.
Specifies that the content of the element is to be reproduced with all of the whitespace preserved.
Specifies that the content of the element is a subscript as in H2O.
Specifies that the content of the element is a superscript as in E=MC2.

section.title: General Computing Elements
section.para: The following are elements used when dealing with computer technology:

seglistitem.seg: Specifies that content describes a response to some user initiated action.
Specifies that the content is the name of a piece of software.
Specifies that the content is text printed on a computer display.
Specifies that the content is the name of a database, or part of a database.
Specifies that the content is an e-mail address.
Specifies that the content is the name of an environment variable.
Specifies that the content is an error code.
Specifies that the content is the name of an error.
Specifies that the content is the text generated whan an error occurs.
Specifies that the content is the name of a file.
Specifies that the content is a piece of computer hardware.
Specifies that the content is an option to a command.
Specifies that the content is the string used as a prompt for data on a computer screen.
Specifies that the content is data a user enters into a computer system.

section.title: Other General Elements
section.para: The following are other general use elements used in Docbook:

seglistitem.seg: Specifies that the content is an abbreviation.
Specifies that the content is an acronym.
Specifies that the content is the first occurence of a new term or is a term that is used a context specific manner.
Specifies that the content is a literal value.
Specifies that the content is optional information. It is typically used in command synopsis.
Specifies that the content represents a value that wil lbe replaced by the user in using the product.

section.title: GUI Elements
section.para: The following are Docbook elements used in documenting a GUI:

seglistitem.seg: Specifies that the content is a keyboard shortcut.
Specifies that the content is the label on a GUI button.
Specifies that the content is a lable on a GUI element other than a button.
Specifies that the content is the name of a menu.
Specifies that the content is a selectable item on a menu.
Specifies that the content is the name of a submenu.
Specifies that the content is the name of a mousebutton.
